oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantitative Electroencephalographic Findings Associated with Nociception Following Surgical Castration in Conscious Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bergamasco, L.
Coetzee, J. F.
Mosher, R. M.
Kotschwar, J. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surgical castration
EEG parameters
animal welfare
model of pain
pain-mitigating procedures
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pain suffered by livestock due to routine husbandry is an issue of growing concern, yet there is no validated model of pain available to assess the efficacy of pain-mitigating procedures. This study assessed quantitative EEG parameters in fully conscious calves in response to surgical castration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2009; 197
